alert.note: Alert for Chase; Custer; Frontier; Hayes; Lincoln; Perkins (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 21 at 10:31AM CST until February 23 at 6:00AM CST by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT CST /11 PM MST/ TONIGHT TO 6 AM CST /5 AM MST/ THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow, blowing snow and bitter cold wind chills possible. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches possible with locally higher amounts possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Garfield, Wheeler, Custer, Perkins and Lincoln Counties. * WHEN...From late Tuesday night through late Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Along with snow and blowing snow, bitter cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero are expected.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Call Nebraska 511 for the latest road information.

area.areaDesc: Chase; Custer; Frontier; Hayes; Lincoln; Perkins
